Chicago, IL Metro > Mount Prospect > Restaurants > Popeye's Chicken&Biscuits Popeye's Chicken&Biscuits (847) 718-9000 1790 W Algonquin Rd , Mt Prospect , IL | Directions 60056 42.036901 -87.963100 View Website Menu Share Save Own this Business? Recommend this business? Thumbs Up Thumbs Down ? not rated yet Add a Photo Cuisine: Cajun&Creole , Chicken , Fast Food , Southern Price: $ Categories: Catering , Restaurants View More Restaurant Special Features: Carry Out , Lunch Spot , Family Style Dining , Family-Friendly Dining Payment Methods: MasterCard, Visa View Less At a Glance ? 100% service “was surprised the other review said that the customer service is good here.” Site Feedback Overview Tips (3) Photos (0) Write a Tip for Popeye's Chicken&Biscuit… Sign in to Write a Tip Write a Tip... optional
Tips for Popeye's Chicken&Biscuits Doesn't Recommend CSMobileUser2 Joined 4 years ago 1.0 March 15, 2010 Horrible!. I was surprised the other review said that the customer service is good here. I have never encountered more dumb, dirty, slow abd lazy people than at this Popeyes. They have only gotten my order right ONCE. They all appear to be high and coMpletely disinterested in what they're doing. I hate goiNg there. U wait 15 minutes for your food only to find out,time and time again, that they screwed up your orderm … View More View Less 0 Heart Doesn't Recommend SimonS600 Joined 3 years ago 1.0 May 25, 2009 This place ranks amongst one of the lousiest fast food store. This place ranks amongst one of the lousiest fast food operations I've encountered in a long time. I was not at all impressed with the quality and flavor of the sides, such as mashed potatoes, and biscuits. The chicken was on the dry side with not much flavor. The customer service was about the only thing that kept me from awarding this place 1 star. She greeted me with a friendly smile and was very prompt with my order. I definitely would not recommend this place to anyone. … View More View Less 0 Heart Doesn't Recommend Cadien Clark Joined 9 years ago July 06, 2008 Cajun-inspired chicken and biscuits chain proffers classic Southern favorites, seafood, sides and desserts with a tangy twist.. In Short This Cajun-style fast food restaurant first opened in New Orleans in 1972 and has since achieved domestic and international fame for its flavorful mild and spicy chicken. In addition to the storied buttermilk biscuits, seafood menu items range from fried popcorn shrimp and shrimp snack "Craver Paks" to chicken sausage jambalaya, catfish baskets and shrimp etouffee. More festive Louisiana regional fare--think red beans and rice, and Mardi Gras cheesecake--rounds out the menu. … View More View Less 0 Heart
